text.32_Gate XXXII, 1_Chapter, 260_Paragraph: My heart is in the east,
text.32_Gate XXXII, 1_Chapter, 261_Paragraph: and I in the uttermost west--
text.32_Gate XXXII, 1_Chapter, 262_Paragraph: How shall I render my vows
text.32_Gate XXXII, 1_Chapter, 264_Paragraph: Zion lieth beneath the fetter of Edom
text.32_Gate XXXII, 1_Chapter, 266_Paragraph: A light thing would it seem to me to leave
text.32_Gate XXXII, 1_Chapter, 267_Paragraph: all the good things of Spain --
text.32_Gate XXXII, 1_Chapter, 268_Paragraph: Seeing how precious in mine eyes to behold the dust of the desolate sanctuary
